With the birth of the Mysore University, the ‘College of Engineering’ was established at Bengaluru in 1917, giving a flip to higher education and to enable Mysore boys play their part in the Engineering field. Initially to start with, tuition and training were given only in two branches of Engineering namely, Civil and Mechanical Engineering. Dating back to 1917 College of Engineering’ was the 5 th Engineering College of the country and first in the Princely State of Mysore. Currently University offers: 
 
Full time BE undergraduate course (5 years) - One 
Full time BE undergraduate course (4years) - Six 
Full time ME postgraduate course (2 years) - Twenty-four 
Part time BE evening under graduate courses (3 years)- Three 
M.Sc. (Engineering) by Research, 
Three-Year full time Ph.D., 
Four-Year part time Ph.D. programmes in all disciplines. 
Ph.D. (QIP) programme in Civil Engineering 

With total Intake of 1159 students. 
Led by Principal Dr. Venugopal K R with main campus situated at K R Circle, Bengaluru and 
Department of Civil and Architecture in JyanaBharathi campus Kengeri Bengaluru.
